A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like:
Lacking any emotion and soul\, Star Wars: The Last Jedi is the latest in a string of disappointments in the series.

While the action and visuals at times are nice and well executed from a technical standpoint\, sadly they are overshadowed by flaws in nearly every area that ultimately sink the film.

The characters are flat and unlikable; the dialogue is inane; the acting is impressively poor; the plot twists are unsatisfying and shrug-worthy; the plot itself is generally nonsensical; the incessant comic relief is forced\, out of place\, and -- most unforgivably -- not funny; and the rewriting of much of the Star Wars universe lore comes off more as a middle finger to fans of the series rather than a genuine attempt to continue and expand the storytelling.

It's very sad to see yet another fumble in the Star Wars saga.  What started off with three fantastic and entertaining films with real heart has devolved into farce.
